JobTitle: Sr. Program Manager, Eats Sales Learning Content & Systems
JobFullDesc: About the RoleAs an experienced Learning Management system administrator, you will be responsible for managing the implementation and maintenance of the global sales learning management system. In close partnership with the Head of Global Sales Training & Development and the global Program Managers, you will partner with members of sales, sales operations, marketing, product, systems, and the larger global training team to design, develop, and launch the new learning hub across our various commercial roles. In this high-impact role, you will join the Global Sales Training and Development Team and will report directly to the  Head of Global Sales Training & Development for Uber’s Delivery business. You will provide guidance and support to the team in designing their learning management system, and supporting teams across the organization as they onboard their content and users into the new learning platform.  This role is ideal for a team-oriented person who can quickly build relationships. You should have a high tolerance for change and ambiguity, and a huge passion for creating amazing learning experiences. This is a unique opportunity for the right person to join an innovative team and help shape the future of learning for one of the fastest growing industries. What You’ll DoAct as the Master Administrator for the Sales Learning Hub; provide support and training for partner teams in building effective content, courses, and curriculums based on the functionality of the toolDevelop timelines and manage plans for migrating users and content from existing systems to the new Learning Hub; Assist regional training teams in ensuring that new users are added to the system and have the correct content available to themPartner with supporting teams and SMEs to architect the structure of the Learning HubCreate content and course foldering ontology, course naming guidelines, and content maintenance policies and schedulesUnderstand organizational, unit, and regional needs and help regional teams and SMEs best use the Learning Hub to meet user needsBuild smart groups based on user region, role, time in role, and other criteria, as necessaryProvide frontline support for user issues, including troubleshooting access and course completion challengesBuild Learning Hub metrics dashboard, including regular reporting of usage, completion, satisfaction, and other critical metrics; support partner analytics teams in pulling the correct learning data to tie to rep, team, and organization performanceWork closely with internal systems team to design and support an integration of content into Salesforce.com; partner with training, marketing, and sales ops teams to tag and organize content to ensure findability within SalesforceStudy new feature rollouts for the tool, identify opportunities for the Uber team to use the functionality, and work with teams to implement the new features Provide suggestions and feedback on current content and curriculums to provide teams ideas for better utilizing tool functionalityMaintain accurate records of content, users, and completions, as necessaryReport on the progress of the implementation and adoption regularly What You’ll NeedMinimum of 5 years of experience as a Learning Management System administrator, Learning Program Manager, Instructional Technologist, or Instructional Designer with an emphasis in LMS/LXP usageAbility to build cross-functional relationships and work collaboratively as a part of large and small teamsExperience working in a fast-paced start-up or tech environment. You must have a tolerance for ambiguity and change. You’ll need an innate hustle and willingness to jump in and do what needs to be done, regardless of your titleExperience in program management, including stakeholder manager and content designAbility to track progress toward goals using PM softwareExperience in managing multiple file types in an LMS, including SCORM, HTML5, video, etc.
